p:
We consider two types of individuals: those infected by the bene, I, and those uninfected by the bene and therefore susceptible, S. The bene is assumed to increase the reproductive rate of infected individuals by a factor
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$(1+s)$$\end{document}
( 1 + s )
where
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$s > 0$$\end{document}
s > 0
. On its own, a reproductive rate advantage would cause the infected population to eventually outnumber the susceptible population, but in this model, the bene can also spread horizontally between individuals, and so S entities are also converted into I entities within the same generation (see Supplemental Text for consideration of a fixed population model). We assume that the bene is transmitted across generations with probability
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$p\in [0,1]$$\end{document}
p ∈ [ 0 , 1 ]
. The growth and infection processes are captured by the time evolution of the S and I population sizes:
1
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$\dot{S}=S-\beta SI+(1+s)(1-p)I,\,\dot{I}=(1+s)pI+\beta SI,$$\end{document}
S ˙
= S − β S I + ( 1 + s ) ( 1 − p ) I ,
I ˙
= ( 1 + s ) p I + β S I ,
where β is the infection rate (
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$\beta \ge 0$$\end{document}
β ≥ 0
). This basic model is similar to S-I models and work done previously (e.g.
34 ).
